statement:
Let $X$ be a locally convex topological vector space, and let
$K \subset X$ be a compact . Then $K$ is the closed convex hull of its
extreme points.

The closed convex hull above is defined as the intersection of all
closed convex subsets of $X$ that contain $K$. This turns out to be the
same as the closure of the convex hull in a topological vector space.
